Notes: The monopoly in UK planning permission. It manages the "case" of a planning application against geospatial data. Hated by architects, essential for councils.
The standard for UK funeral directors. Manages the logistics of the deceased, from hospital collection to burial. Morbidly reliable, very dated interface.
Used by independent vets. It lacks the polish of the corporate consolidator software (Covetrus). Pure transaction and case history logging.
The software that runs the turnstiles at Council swimming pools. Incredibly sticky because it controls physical hardware entry. Legacy database feel.
Unique model: they provide the software AND the outsourced cashier service. Sticky because they handle the heavy regulatory burden of SRA Accounts Rules.
The operating system for UK trucking. Manages the "case" of a pallet from depot to delivery. Heavy on invoicing and driver timesheets.
Used by NHS and Police OH departments. Tracks employee health surveillance. Very rigid workflow to ensure medical compliance.
Recently swallowed by Access. Originally a desktop-heavy system for logging daily care notes in nursing homes. Very "clicky" interface.
The dominant independent PMS for UK opticians. Handles the retail (glasses) and the clinical (eye test) in one flow. Very feature-dense.
Known as "Cash for Windows". Used by companies installing fire alarms. It is a service management ERP that feels like it hasn't changed since 2005.
The hidden engine of UK universities. Manages the "case" of a room booking against complex academic constraints. Niche, complex logic.
A niche system for grant-making trusts. It tracks the application and payout of funds. Often replaced by Salesforce, but AIMS holds the legacy market.
Manages boat moorings, electricity metering, and harbour dues. Niche "visual" case management for marina masters. Very specific billing logic.
The workhorse for Criminal Legal Aid firms. Connects directly to the government's Legal Aid Agency portals. The UI is a wrapper for government forms.
Focuses purely on the "Repairs" case. Used by contractors fixing boilers. Highly configurable but the back-end setup is arduous.
The absolute giant of UK dentistry. Expensive, old-fashioned, but integrated with NHS dental claiming (UDAs). Hard to leave due to NHS pipework.
CRM combined with CAD mapping for tree surgeons. It tracks the "case" of a tree protection order. Tiny team, highly specific market.
Used by mediators to handle divorce cases. Handles the specific "Legal Aid for Mediation" forms. Effectively a specialized form-filler.
The standard for high street brokers. Manages the client application for a loan. Heavy compliance logic (FCA rules) makes it sticky.
Now owned by a US giant but very prevalent in UK high streets. Desktop-first heritage. Replaces the appointment book.
